snippet: The policy puts a measure of oversight on a technology that was designed to hunt terrorists overseas but has become popular for fighting domestic crime.
abstract: New Justice Dept policy says federal agents will need warrant to use powerful device for cellphone surveillance; regulations for tool, which simulates cell tower and was originally developed to fight terrorism, restrict what data can be collected and how long it can be kept; privacy advocates lament policy doesn't cover device's use by local law enforcement.
lead_paragraph: The policy puts a measure of oversight on a technology that was designed to hunt terrorists overseas but has become popular for fighting domestic crime.

headline.main: Justice Dept. to Require Warrants for Some Cellphone Tracking
headline.print_headline: Justice Department Will Limit Use of Cellphone Eavesdropper
